recommendations.recommendation: Better than Lamune but still. I`d prefer to see the movie mentioned in this story instead of itself...
Nice Story and Romance. but is unfortunately just 4 episode. By The Way, The Song is good ^_^

anime.description: Seventeen-year-old http://anidb.net/ch26379 [Nakaido Hirosuke] is just your average high school student. One morning as he arrives at the train station on his way to school, he catches sight of a beautiful girl, http://anidb.net/ch26380 [Ajimu Yasuna], and immediately falls for her. The two of them get to know each other and become friends, but he cannot confess his feelings and she is unsure of hers. As events and other people present obstacles for the potential couple to clear, their relationship begins to develop and their feelings become clear. Source: ANN

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: slow when it comes to love
tag.description: The main protagonists in this anime have a very hard time trying to express their feelings to each other. They simply will not finally confess their love. In some cases this romance element is based on unrequited love, or an absurd amount of shyness.

tag.name: multiple couples
tag.description: More than one couple is developed in the anime.

tag.name: first kiss
tag.description: The first kiss plays a role in this anime. Especially for the female cast this can be quite an important moment, so that stealing ones first kiss is serious for them.

tag.name: unrequited love
tag.description: At least one character has a romantic interest in another one, but the feelings are not returned. This is the cornerstone of all love triangles or love polygons.

tag.name: love polygon
tag.description: A love polygon refers to a romantic relationship involving n people. Although a love triangle is not limited to just heterosexual relationships, in anime, it usually deals with two females liking one male and vice versa.

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: pantsu
tag.description: "Panties" in Japanese. Upskirt views in various positions are typical, however all forms of partial or fully exposed panties are accepted. Exposure is usually accidental, but may also be deliberate. Pantsu views may be exclusive to the viewer without impacting any characters. Bikinis are not pantsu.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: summer festival
tag.description: The summer festival is used to show off the female protagonists in traditional Japanese clothing — the yukata — a casual form of kimono. The festivities include food stalls (cotton candy, candy apples, choco bananas, taiyaki), various games (scoop goldfishes), and a fireworks display.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: boy meets girl
tag.description: A classical type of plot in story writing, where the story begins with a boy meeting a girl leading to romantic development between the two. More often than not the boy loses the girl later on and has to find her again.

tag.name: summer
tag.description: At least one of the episodes takes place in summer. Think oppressively warm weather, summer vacation, summer school, summer festival, or a visit to the beach.

tag.name: female protagonist
tag.description: The anime has a female protagonist.

tag.name: misunderstanding
tag.description: Suggests that a large portion of storyline revolves around a rather large misunderstanding between two or more characters, usually forming long lasting situations of separation or hostility between all those involved. A large portion of the story may be dedicated to gradually working all parties into a mutual understanding to true intentions or changes of heart.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: season
tag.description: A season is a division of the year, marked by changes in weather, ecology, and hours of daylight. Seasons result from the yearly orbit of the Earth around the Sun and the tilt of the Earth`s rotational axis relative to the plane of the orbit. In temperate and polar regions, the seasons are marked by changes in the intensity of sunlight that reaches the Earth`s surface, variations of which may cause animals to go into hibernation or to migrate, and plants to be dormant. During May, June, and July, the northern hemisphere is exposed to more direct sunlight because the hemisphere faces the sun. The same is true of the southern hemisphere in November, December, and January. It is the tilt of the Earth that causes the Sun to be higher in the sky during the summer months which increases the solar flux. However, due to seasonal lag, June, July, and August are the hottest months in the northern hemisphere and December, January, and February are the hottest months in the southern hemisphere. In temperate and subpolar regions, four calendar-based seasons (with their adjectives) are generally recognized: spring (vernal), summer (estival), autumn (autumnal), fall and winter (hibernal). Ecologists often use a six-season model for temperate climate regions that includes pre-spring (prevernal) and late summer (serotinal) as distinct seasons along with the traditional four. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Master
character.description: The master of the bar "J.O.D." where http://anidb.net/ch26380 [Yasuna] works and performs on stage (and he accompanies her on the guitar then).

character.name: Nakaido Hirosuke
character.description: Nakaido Hirosuke is the male protagonist of the story. He lives together with http://anidb.net/ch26430 [his mother] and http://anidb.net/ch26438 [his grandmother]; his father was a film actor. At the beginning of this story Hirosuke meets a http://anidb.net/ch26380 [beautiful girl] at the train station. He falls in love at first sight but is mistaken for a molester by her.

character.name: Ajimu Yasuna
character.description: Ajimu Yasuna, the eponymous character, lived in Tokyo until a few months before the beginning of this story but now attends the same high school as http://anidb.net/ch26382 [Suzue]. She likes music, history and the Japanese language, all of which results in her composing and playing her own songs: As a side job she plays Hawaiian music on her ukulele twice a week in the bar http://anidb.net/ch26470 [J.O.D.]. When she meets http://anidb.net/ch26379 [Hirosuke] the first time she mistakes him for a molester first, then considers him a stalker when the boy desperately tries to clear up the misunderstanding, before they eventually form a friendship. But Yasuna hasn`t moved on after http://anidb.net/ch26448 [learning] about the death of her former boyfriend http://anidb.net/ch26383 [Otomine Yuuma].

character.name: Izumiya Kazuki
character.description: Izumiya Kazuki is http://anidb.net/ch26379 [Hirosuke]`s buddy at school. During summer he works in a flower shop (and wears a straw hat when delivering flowers to customers). Kazuki is quite busy dating various girls but with no lasting results so far. Kazuki encourages Hirosuke to confess his feelings to http://anidb.net/ch26380 [Yasuna] but he also talks him into joining him to a four-way date with two "college girls", one of them being http://anidb.net/ch26382 [Suzue].

character.name: Takemoto Suzue
character.description: Takemoto Suzue is a high-school student (although she pretends to be a college student when dating boys). She takes lessons in traditional Japanese dance, and on one occasion performs a hula dance on stage to http://anidb.net/ch26380 [Yasuna]`s music but her true side job is modeling (much to the displeasure of http://anidb.net/ch26431 [her father]). During the "foursome date" arranged by http://anidb.net/ch26381 [Kazuki] she immediately gets interested in http://anidb.net/ch26379 [Hirosuke], and despite being aware of the boy having fallen for Yasuna (whose name name he learned only from Suzue as both girls attend the same school) she repeatedly asks Hirosuke out. Actually her relation to Hirosuke has some history: When they were children the boy caught her rabbits that she let escape and brought them back to her. But Hirosuke doesn`t even remember that they are childhood friends.

character.name: Otomine Yuuma
character.description: Otomine Yuuna, a talented painter, was http://anidb.net/ch26380 [Yasuna]`s boyfriend until one year before the beginning of this story. He never was clear about what exactly Yasuna meant for him. Actually he just moved to London and made Yasuna believe he was dead, with the help of their mutual friend http://anidb.net/ch26448 [Koharu-chan]; his sudden return to Japan in episode 3 makes sorting out the feelings of all major character in this story a rollercoaster.

character.name: Izumiya Moe
character.description: Izumiya Moe is http://anidb.net/ch26381 [Kazuki]`s younger sister. During summer holidays she works at the reception desk and by cleaning rooms of her family`s (?) inn when http://anidb.net/ch26383 [an interesting new customer] arrives whom she quickly takes kindly to, to the chagrin of her brother.

character.name: Joshikousei
character.description: A female High-School Student from the school`s baseball team who repeatedly hits http://anidb.net/ch26379 [Hirosuke] with balls gone astray.

character.name: Nakaido Chiyo
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch26379 [Hirosuke]`s mother.

character.name: Takemoto Atsuhiro
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch26382 [Suzue]`s father. He is very strict about his daughter having contact with boys, and also doesn`t approve of Suzue`s job. (Which is all we ever learn about him in his only scene.)

character.name: Ajimu Tamaki
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch26380 [Yasuna]`s mother Ajimu Tamaki runs an import good store named "Ka Makani" (Hawaiian for "Wind") that includes a video rental service. Her husband Shougo is pilot of an international airline (and he hasn`t been home for three months so he never occurs in this story). Being aware of the consequences of Yasuna`s relation to http://anidb.net/ch26383 [Yuuma] in the past she encourages the relation between her daughter and http://anidb.net/ch26379 [Hirosuke].

character.name: Coach
character.description: The coach of the Gateball team of http://anidb.net/ch26438 [Hirosuke`s grandmother].

character.name: Obaasan
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch26379 [Hirosuke]`s grandmother may be old and absentminded but can be quite active occasionally. She plays computer games with her grandson and makes him play in her gateball team.

character.name: Akizuki Kyouko
character.description: Akizuki Kyouko is http://anidb.net/ch26382 [Suzue]`s friend and one of the participants in the four-way date arranged by http://anidb.net/ch26381 [Kazuki]. But actually she prefers older men... and working part-time in http://anidb.net/ch26378 [Master]`s in offers her certain opportunities.

character.name: Couple Onna
character.description: A female customer of `s http://anidb.net/ch26432 [Ajimu Tamaki]`s video rental service, shopping there together with her male companion. (Just one dialog line.)

character.name: Kyoushi
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch26379 [Hirosuke]`s and http://anidb.net/ch26381 [Kazuki]`s literature teacher at school. (Just two dialog lines, never visible.)

character.name: Ojisan
character.description: He runs the inn where http://anidb.net/ch26420 [Izumiya Moe] helps out. (He might be the father of http://anidb.net/ch26420 [Moe] and http://anidb.net/ch26381 [Kazuki] but his name is never mentioned.)

character.name: Koharu-chan
character.description: Koharu-chan is the girl on the photograph together with http://anidb.net/ch26380 [Yasuna] and http://anidb.net/ch26383 [Yuuma]. It was her who brought Yasuna the message about Yuuma`s death but her exact relation to these two isn`t explained in the anime (she is Yasuna`s childhood friend from elementary school, says the game; her full name Miyasaka Koharu is given only in the game; no dialog lines, no anime credits.) Which means that she kept Yuuma`s secret about moving to London instead.

character.name: Momodou Yayoi
character.description: An obese and pushy woman commuting with the same train as http://anidb.net/ch26380 [Yasuna] and http://anidb.net/ch26379 [Hirosuke] every day. (Her name never appears in the anime but she appears in every episode and is credited under this name in each of these.)

character.name: J.O.D.
character.description: The J.O.D. bar offers live music to its customers, with http://anidb.net/ch26380 [Yasuna] playing there twice every week. Its http://anidb.net/ch26378 [Master] can be considered lucky to have a number of attractive girls available for part-time jobs as waitresses.
